result.execSummary:
The defendant Lance Benjamin Gordon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(1m)(a).
  • Possess Short-barreled Shotgun/Rifle, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.28(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lance Benjamin Gordon

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
11:01 AM Defendant Lance Benjamin Gordon in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Lance Benjamin Gordon.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. State notes defendant is to be arraigned. Will be entering plea to both counts. Sentence of 1.5 year IC and 2.5 years of ES. The sentences on each count will be concurrent to each other but will run consecutive to Bayfield County case 15CF159 and Ashland County cases 20CF33 and 19CF115. Conditions include $10 fine plus costs, programming as deemed appropriate by DOC. 
Defendant pleads no contest. Attorney Rosenthal stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the defendant's plea. Court finds that the defendant's pleas have been knowingly and voluntarily made. Court finds the defendant guilty and judgment of conviction is entered. State makes statement, recites defendant's previous criminal history. Notes most of history involves drug usage. Asks court to adopt joint recommendation. DOC will be requesting revocation in cases in other counties. Court notes that if the other counties have not imposed sentence, Court cannot order sentences to run concurrent. Attorney Rosenthal notes that there is imposed and stayed sentence in 19CF115. Reviews the pending sentences in Bayfield and Ashland County cases. The intent of the agreement is to have this case run concurrently to the other cases. Notes AODA issues and hopes defendant will be accepted into programming. Defendant makes statement to the court.  
Court orders 4 year prison sentence, fashioned as 1.5 years (18 mo) IC and 2.5 (30 mo) years of ES. The sentences on each count will be concurrent to each other but will run consecutive to Bayfield County case 15CF159 and Ashland County cases 20CF33 and 19CF115. 0 days credit. Conditions include $10 fine plus costs, programming as deemed appropriate by DOC. Eligible for both programs.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
8:15 AM Defendant Lance Benjamin Gordon in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Foster Rosenthal in court for Lance Benjamin Gordon.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Rosenthal- Client will waive prelim
Court finds probable cause, he is bound over for arraignment. Sets date
Arraignment scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 11:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No use or possession of a dangerous weapons including firearms.

1:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lance Benjamin Gordon appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Hoffman appeared by video for defendant Benjamin Gordon. Defendant verified address. Court reviews with defendant options of obtaining counsel. Attorney Hoffman received complaint, waives reading and requests preliminary hearing. State requests $1,000 cash bail and conditions of no use or possession of dangerous weapons. Defendant has lengthy criminal history with one fta. Also, several cases out of Ashland and Bayfield County and is currently on probation supervision. Attorney Hoffman notes defendant has lived in Ashland Co for 30 years and he is on probation supervision. Court orders $1,000 cash bail with condition of no use or possession of a dangerous weapons including firearms.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
